description: Enterprise techniques used by MCMD, ATT&CK software S0500 v1.0
name: MCMD (S0500)

techniques.comment: [MCMD](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0500) can use HTTPS in communication with C2 web servers.(Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)
[MCMD](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0500) can use Registry Run Keys for persistence.(Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)
[MCMD](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0500) can launch a console process (cmd.exe) with redirected standard input and output.(Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)
[MCMD](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0500) has the ability to upload files from an infected device.(Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)
[MCMD](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0500) can modify processes to prevent them from being visible on the desktop.(Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)
[MCMD](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0500) has the ability to remove set Registry Keys.(Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)
[MCMD](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0500) can upload additional files to a compromised host.(Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)
[MCMD](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0500) has been named Readme.txt to appear legitimate.(Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)
[MCMD](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0500) can Base64 encode output strings prior to sending to C2.(Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)
[MCMD](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0500) can use scheduled tasks for persistence.(Citation: Secureworks MCMD July 2019)
